com.sap.cloud.sdk.cloudplatform.metering

Class MeteringStats

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sap.cloud.sdk.cloudplatform.metering.MeteringStats

  • public class MeteringStats
extends Object
    Stores access numbers to the different APIs.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MeteringStats

        public MeteringStats(String serviceId,
                     Role meteringRole,
                     String meteringServiceDestinationName)
        Initializes a new MeteringStats with the given service id, role and metering service destination name.
        Parameters:
        serviceId - The id needed for the metering service.
        meteringRole - The role needed to obtain tenant information.
        meteringServiceDestinationName - The name of the metering destination.

    • Method Detail

      • record

        public long record(TenantMetricKeyPair key)
        Record a single access by the tenant to the API specified by the key.
        Parameters:
        key - The metric key.
        Returns:
        The updated number of accesses.

      • record

        public long record(TenantMetricKeyPair key,
                   long increment)
        Record a specified number accesses by a the tenant to the API specified by the key.
        Parameters:
        key - The metric key.
        increment - The number of API accesses to record.
        Returns:
        The updated number of accesses.

      • getApiCountsFor

        public long getApiCountsFor(TenantMetricKeyPair key)
        Getter for the current number of API accesses.
        Parameters:
        key - The metric key to get the number of accesses for.
        Returns:
        The number of accesses of the tenant to the API specified by the key.

      • getSumOfApiCounts

        public long getSumOfApiCounts()
        Aggregates the number of API accesses over all entries.
        Returns:
        The number of overall API accesses.

      • getDistinctApiCounts

        public long getDistinctApiCounts()
        Number of metric key stored.
        Returns:
        The number of stored metric keys.

      • sendToMeteringService

        public void sendToMeteringService()
                           throws TenantNotAvailableException,
                                  TenantAccessException
        Sends the stored data to the metering service.
        Throws:
        TenantNotAvailableException - If there is currently no Tenant available. This typically occurs when trying to access the tenant within code that is running outside any tenant context, e.g., within a background task.
        TenantAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the Tenant.
